quotes.author: Robin Williams
quotes.quote: You're only given a little spark of madness, and if you lose that, you're nothing.

quotes.author: Michael J. Brooks
quotes.text: Be ruthless to systems, be kind to people.

quotes.author: Ernesto 'Che' Guevara
quotes.text: No creo que seamos parientes muy cercanos, pero si Ud. es capaz de temblar de indignación cada vez que se comete una injusticia en el mundo, somos compañeros, que es lo más importante.
quotes.translation: I don't think you and I are very closely related, however, if you are capable of trembling with indignation each time that an injustice is committed anywhere in the world, we are comrades, and that is more important.
quotes.source: from a letter to Maria Rosario Guevara, 1964

quotes.author: Eugene V. Debs
quotes.text: The most heroic word in all languages is REVOLUTION.

quotes.author: Karel Čapek
quotes.text: Hallo, vy lidé, Chief Salamander vám jménem všech Mloků světa nabízí spolupráci. Budete s námi pracovat na odbourání vašeho světa. Děkujeme vám
quotes.translation: Hello you people, Chief Salamander, in the name of all newts everywhere, offers collaboration with you. You will collaborate with us in the demolition of your world. Thank you.

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.text: Anyone who loves freedom owes such a debt to the Red Army that it can never be repaid.
quotes.source: part of a statement for Pravda 23.02.1942 (p. 4)

quotes.author: John Brown
quotes.text: God sees it. I have only a short time to live—only one death to die, and I will die fighting for this cause.
quotes.source: reportedly said following the Battle of Osawatomie, August 1856

quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
quotes.text: The process by which banks create money is so simple that the mind is repelled.
quotes.source: Money: Whence It Came, Where It Went p. 29

quotes.author: Smedley D. Butler
quotes.text: The only way to smash this racket is to conscript capital and industry and labor before the nations manhood can be conscripted.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.text: It is 'society' which provides man with food, clothing, a home, the tools of work, language, the forms of thought, and most of the content of thought; his life is made possible through the labor and the accomplishments of the many millions past and present who are all hidden behind the small word 'society.'
quotes.source: from 'Why Socialism?' in the Monthly Review, 1949

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.text: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.

quotes.author: Smedley D. Butler
quotes.text: Our flag belongs to all of us Americans and we Americans should have a voice in where it is flown.
quotes.source: closing statement of his 1939 speech 'Avoiding War in the Pacific', collected in War Is A Racket, 1935

quotes.author: Reggie Watts
quotes.text: You don’t need to be a geopolitics scholar to know that starving children and slaughtering families is wrong. Your membership in the human family gives you authority and, indeed, responsibility to speak up. All positive change starts with conscious and loving people raising their voices and working together to bring a better world into existence.
quotes.source: responding to Thom Yorke's statement on Israel's genocide in Gaza, via Instagram, 30.05.2025

quotes.author: Greta Thunberg
quotes.text: For me, there is no way of distinguishing the two. We cannot have climate justice without social justice. The reason why I am a climate activist is not because I want to protect trees. I’m a climate activist because I care about human and planetary well-being, and those are extremely interlinked.
quotes.source: onboard the Madleen towards Gaza, speaking to Amy Goodman on Democracy Now!, June 04 2025

quotes.text: A society grows great when old men plant trees whose shade they know they shall never sit in.
